intro: Corydalis shimienensis, commonly known as the Shimien poppy, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, often pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions and has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
